Class InputOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • InputOutput

  • public class InputOutput
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Daniel Blackley -- 160007728 This class is responsible for exception handling, saving and Loading files A lot of this I have used in my previous work and is just light modifications on what has been done before, nothing too complicated Also credit to https://my.dundee.ac.uk/webapps/blackboard/content/listContent.jsp?course_id=_57691_1&content_id=_5023268_1 which had examples of reading and writing to files which i used to jog my memory, hence why there are a lot of similar variable names

      InputOutput()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNodes(Node students, java.lang.String[] information)
      method used when opening and reading a file that adds a node the the tree Primary function is to change strings to integers
      Node readFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Fairly basic method that opens the file then splits up the file and sends it to the Node class line by line
      void setupFileSaving(java.lang.String fileName, Node nodeToSave)
      This method was not able to run Independently from the Node class, so most of the saving was done in the Node class and this was just used to set up the initial parts to be passed on to Node
      Node setUpNode(java.lang.String[] information)
      Sets up the root node, so that other nodes can be added
      java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String stringToSplit)
      basic method that changes a string to a list of strings, split by a ","
      int validateIntegerInput(int max)
      Makes sure the user enters a integer in the Correct range of values and also makes sure that the user doesn't attempt to enter a string
      java.lang.String validateStringInput()
      Takes asks the user to input a string and attempts to catch any potential errors There are not many errors one can catch when a string is being inputed however I have included a line to make sure the user doesn't just leave it blank

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • validateStringInput

        public java.lang.String validateStringInput()
        Takes asks the user to input a string and attempts to catch any potential errors There are not many errors one can catch when a string is being inputed however I have included a line to make sure the user doesn't just leave it blank
        Returns:
        Valid String

      • setupFileSaving

        public void setupFileSaving(java.lang.String fileName,
                            Node nodeToSave)
        This method was not able to run Independently from the Node class, so most of the saving was done in the Node class and this was just used to set up the initial parts to be passed on to Node
        Parameters:
        fileName - The filename that the file will be saved as
        nodeToSave - The tree that we want to save

      • readFromFile

        public Node readFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Fairly basic method that opens the file then splits up the file and sends it to the Node class line by line
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file the user wishes to open
        Returns:
        The Tree that the user has loaded

      • addNodes

        public void addNodes(Node students,
                     java.lang.String[] information)
        method used when opening and reading a file that adds a node the the tree Primary function is to change strings to integers
        Parameters:
        students - The tree we want to add to
        information - The information of the student at the relevant node

      • setUpNode

        public Node setUpNode(java.lang.String[] information)
        Sets up the root node, so that other nodes can be added
        Parameters:
        information - Information of the student at the root node
        Returns:
        The tree we are adding nodes to

      • splitString

        public java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String stringToSplit)
        basic method that changes a string to a list of strings, split by a ","
        Parameters:
        stringToSplit - The string we want to split
        Returns:
        The split up string

      • validateIntegerInput

        public int validateIntegerInput(int max)
        Makes sure the user enters a integer in the Correct range of values and also makes sure that the user doesn't attempt to enter a string
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number the user may enter
        Returns:
        the validated input
